Now I'm usually not a sandwich gal, but I devoured this in mere minutes. Then there's the green waffle which is a cross between savory and sweet. I would prefer tasting more of the "green" coz I don't have a sweet tooth, either. However it was still yummy. No standout, but  yummy. I would highly recommend this cute hole in the wall for a good bargain lunch. You can't beat $4 for a satisfying lunch!
author: C P.

description:
First off, they're very inexpensive for lunch in the Financial District.  $3.00 for a pretty big sandwich (pretty big for a vietnamese sandwich, at least) is a steal.

I like the BBQ Chicken sandwich - it's my favorite so far, but the others are good too, if you like the pork or meatballs.

One thing I will say is that it takes a while to have a sandwich made.  I would recommend calling ahead to get your sandwich made.  There's just one guy making the food and the line can start building up pretty quickly.
author: Steve L.

description:
The green waffle was delicious--hot, steaming, and gooey.  Good enough on its own to make syrup jealous.

Unfortunately, the pork sandwich was lackluster.  I didn't expect much for a $4 sando and it mostly met my expectations... except the pork was more than 50% fat.  I don't mind a little flavor in my meat, but this was glorified strips of pork fat.

The rest of the sando was okay, pickled carrots and jalapenos.  The bread was good, soft with a crunchy crust.  I'll try it again with a different meat, but now I'm leery.  The waffle salvaged the rating.
author: Chris S.

description:
Unfortunately my first experience with this place was the fancy pork. It was some processed sliced pork log....not at all what I expected.  I thought it would somehow be a step up from the regular pork. Definately not the case...I did not like it at all. I will give it one more try with a non-fancy meat.

They should really re-label that sandwhich.
author: angela p.

description: AWESOME! Absolutely delicious! I love this little walk up window, perfect for getting a Vietnamese sandwich to go and sit by the bay. Very friendly and very fast!!!
author: Frank B.

description: Steaming hot, green coconut waffle!  So delicately sweet, I could eat one every day.  Bonus: they feel kinda "healthy" too since there are no sugary toppings on them.
author: Krystle S.

description: I am excited to find this deli by work. The selection is small but pretty much everything on the menu is good. I especially love the coconut flavor waffle. The cook is super nice and really efficient in getting the order deliver.
author: Ervinna L.

description: I went here yesterday for the first time.  The sandwich was cheap and delicious.  As I am not an expert in Vietnamese sandwiches I don't know how it ranked along those lines.  I also tried the shrimp rolls which were good.  Maybe too much lettuce.  But I'm going back today to try the pork.  Can anyone tell me what fancy pork is?  I didn't know pig was ever considered fancy.
author: Jen C.

description:
3.5
solid banh mi @ a bargain price for this area.  the fact that it's a tiny shit shack in the middle of the financial district gives them a certain bit of cred that makes me throw my business their way.  not the best not the worst and occasionally i curse to get my point across.
author: beltrand a.

description: I prefer the bahn mi at Les Croissant but service is fast and the fellow was really calm and nice.  The green coconut waffles are delicious--not too sweet.  They're "green" because he uses crushed "padan" leaves in them which helps give them the flavor.  Only $2 for a whole waffle.
author: Kai T.

description:
i work across the street, and never knew this joint existed.  all those times i walked by, i've never seen it.

the baguette is definitely the right consistency, crispy on the outside, airy on the inside.  just enough mayo/sauce on the inside, and an ample amount of chicken (i had the BBQ Chicken).

there is a wait.  it's one dude, making vietnamese sandwiches.  i think we waited like 15 minutes or so.  downtown sf, that could be a deal breaker especially if you want to be in and out quickly.  but worth a definite go-back when i'm looking for a cheap lunch.
author: Jason J.

description: I had the combination - which had both pork and chicken.  A little small for my taste - and not too many veggies.    The best thing it had going for it though was the flavor.  The bread was also just okay - small and it seemed more chewy which is a bit of a different experience.   I also had the waffle - while the flavor was good, it was a bit soft.  So if you ever order this, ask for a fresh waffle and perhaps tell him to leave it a bit longer on the waffle iron.
author: Gina C.

description: Not even the best vietnamese sandwich in the FiDi......doesn't compare to my current favorite at Kearny/Sacramento.....does the trick for a cheap fix,  but after having tried both the #1 and the #2, i think it may be a whlie before i come back.
author: Pete D.

description: The pork sandwhich is ok, but nothing to write home about.  The ingredients were definitely fresh, but lacked some spice.  The pork was a little on the fatty side, so next time I will try a tofu sandwich.  Overall, for $4 it was a decent lunch though and I appreciated the friendliness of everyone and the speed (I went after 1:30).
author: K B.

description: Pretty decent sandwich. Good size, not huge like some places. Got the classic pork. The green coconut waffle was quite nice, and the iced coffee with condensed milk is super strong.
author: Brent F.

description: Just as yelp is saying for me when I click four stars, I'm a fan. The other 12908430918 reviews cover that this place is tasty and cheap but what they don't tell you is that if you ask for extra meat, they will give you double for free.
author: Collin G.

description: You can't help but like this place. Tasty vietnamese sandwiches, super friendly service, and at least when I went, samples of the waffle everyone raves about. I wish this place the best of luck
author: Jason B.

description: this place is alright, the tofu could be a bit more flavorful, and the sandwich would have benefitted from some mayo, but they bread is fresh and tasty.
author: Jared Z.

description: after reading on yelp talk of all the yelpers raving about these vietnamese sandwiches, i was curious.  so i went to the window and asked the sandwich maker which pork was better, he said do the combo and get both.  $1 tip in the jar for that.  the sandwich smells delicious and each bite packs a punch, but being the little pig that i am, it could've had more pork in the sandwich.
author: Pickle R.

description: i totally didn't know this existed except for the brilliance of my coworker Matt and the day he unveiled this blessed place to me saved me from a horrible hungover state.  $4 for a Vietnamese sandwich is unbeatable. i recommend skipping the fancy pork/chicken (it's like cold cut deli meat) and going with a regular pork or chicken.  the spicy/sweet mixture is right on and i am now contemplating getting 2 sandwiches for the road from now on.  what i really want is 1.5 but figure i can save the other .5 for a few hours later.
author: Cathy L.

description: i usually come here because i want to eat something with cilantro in it, and the coconut waffles are fun to munch on while you're waiting. i get the pork sandwich with a little jalapeno - it's quite filling for being so cheap. and the owner is friendly!
author: David P.

description: Finally!  A decent place to get lunch for cheap in the financial district.  I'm sick of paying over $10 for a basic sandwich.  This place has great vietnamese sandwiches with fresh ingredients and for only $4!  Can't beat that.  Their bbq chicken sandwich can rival Out the Door's...  And the guy who works there is always so nice.
author: Ming Y.

description: I love love love the tofu sandwiches from here.  Jesse is incredibly considerate and really cares about his customers, which in this day and age is getting rarer and rarer. I'm so glad my friend and I stumbled on this window when we were sick of the same old places for lunch nearby.
author: Jessica L.
